content: raggsokker a tutorial by øyonn steen materials yarn sandnes perfect 100 grams + a bit of contrasting yarn if you want to make stripes needles 3 5 mm 5 dpns size womens size 38 mens size 44 1 if you want a bigger size just knit the heel flap and the foot a little longer gauge 24 sts pr 10 cm note these traditional norwegian socks are made with dk weight yarn pattern cast on 48 56 knit in the round cuff *k2 p2* for 14 16 cm or however long you want it to be make stripes with a contrasting yarn if you want to heel knit the sts from two needles over on one 1 the sizing is given in european sizes this equals uk size 5 w and 9 m us size 7 w and 10 m aus size 6 w and 9 m and japanese size 23 5 w and 27 m knit the heel flap over these 24 28 sts leaving the other sts on the needles for the time being the heel and foot is knit in stockinette stitch when you knit the heel flap remember to slip the first stitch on every row knit until the heel flap measures 5 6 cm the heel decreases start on a ws row purl 16 18 sts turn knit 8 8 sts turn your knitting now looks like this you have three sections you work on the middle section while slowly decreasing the sts on the outer sections row 1 p until one st remain on the middle section p2tog p1 turn row 2 knit until one st remain on the middle section k2tog k1 turn row 3 p one row middle section only row 4 k one row middle section only repeat these four row until there are no more sts in the outer sections your knitting now looks like this holding your knitting this way you pick up sts along the heel flap the number of sts depends on how long you made your heel flap your knitting should now look like this with the same needle you have all your heel sts on you knit the sts from the first needle of picked up sts so that your knitting looks like this this is the point where you start knitting in the round again the two needles that were holding sts for you are now the top of the foot make sure the sts you picked up are all on the needles belonging to the bottom of the foot when you come to the second needle of picked up sts these are knit through the back loop adjust the number of sts on the two needles with the picked up sts so that you have an equal number of sts on each needle your round now begins at the bottom of the foot gusset row 1 knit until 3 sts are left on needle # 1 k2tog k1 knit across needles # 2
